title: TestInPlaceUpdates(Distrib|Standalone) failures
description:
From https://jenkins.thetaphi.de/job/Lucene-Solr-master-Linux/18881/, reproduces for me:


Checking out Revision d8d61ff61d1d798f5e3853ef66bc485d0d403f18 (refs/remotes/origin/master)

   [junit4] FAILURE 77.7s J2 | TestInPlaceUpdatesDistrib.test <<<
   [junit4]    > Throwable #1: java.lang.AssertionError: Earlier: [79, 79, 79], now: [78, 78, 78]

comments.content: Thanks Steve. I'm able to reproduce it and looking into it.
comments.author: Ishan Chattopadhyaya

comments.content:
Seems like there were segment merges during the commit just preceding the assert, and hence the docids changed. Here's a patch switching the merge policy factory for the test from LogDocMergePolicy to NoMergePolicyFactory.

The affected seed passes, and about 500 rounds of beasting on my laptop seems to pass.
comments.author: Ishan Chattopadhyaya

Commit 6520d06ce763c885dc9479370a0cc26612229e46 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Ishan Chattopadhyaya

SOLR-10079: Test fix for TestInPlaceUpdatesDistrib, using clearIndex()

comments.content: This test is flagged as the newest flakey test we have. Not sure if it's related to this issue or a new one? I'll attach a fail log.

comments.content:
This branch_6x failure from ASF Jenkins https://builds.apache.org/job/Lucene-Solr-NightlyTests-6.x/305/ reproduces for me, but only if I remove the -Dtests.method=testUpdatingDocValues cmdline param:


Checking out Revision 89baa4fd43477c3b0be59e81299b651d70b3c128 (refs/remotes/origin/branch_6x)

comments.content:
Few observations on these failures:

	Ever since this issue was closed (14 March), I haven't seen any failures based on the regular/default replication scheme.
	Since SOLR-9835 was committed, this test was changed to randomly use the new replication scheme 50% of the time.
	The above failures are both due to the new replication scheme.
	This test (TestInPlaceUpdatesDistrib) runs for about 45sec on default replication scheme, but takes around 346sec when using new replication. A lot of the time seems to be spend in IndexFetcher in new replication scheme.
	Based on this, does it make sense to use the new replication scheme only on a @Nightly basis?



Cao Manh Dat, WDYT?
comments.author: Ishan Chattopadhyaya

comments.content: Re-opening due to new failures after SOLR-9835 merge.
comments.author: Ishan Chattopadhyaya

comments.content: Ishan Chattopadhyaya Sure, I will take a look at this issue. I think I can make the test faster without adding @Nightly
comments.author: Cao Manh Dat

comments.content:
Commit e09273943b41330ca224377e2e6b6ca54dce84eb in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Cao Manh Dat
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=e092739 ]

SOLR-10079: Speedup TestInPlaceUpdatesDistrib in new replication mode
comments.author: ASF subversion and git services

comments.content: Ishan Chattopadhyaya It seems that buildRandomIndex() create many files ( 1100 files need to be downloaded with the seed at SOLR-10354 ), and we download one by one file from leader so the test is very slow.
comments.author: Cao Manh Dat

comments.content: I think we can do less commits in buildRandomIndex() when new replication mode is used.
comments.author: Ishan Chattopadhyaya

comments.content: The problem is TestInjection.waitForInSyncWithLeader() is sensitive with very big commit so It return true before the commit actually finish. Here are the patch that reduce the size of commit and speedup TestInPlaceUpdatesDistrib. I think this also fix SOLR-10354.
comments.author: Cao Manh Dat

[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=144091a ]

SOLR-10079: TestInPlaceUpdates(Distrib|Standalone) failures
